abstract: The JPMorgan Chase chief executive, who will testify on Tuesday before the House Financial Services Committee, plans to stick to the script from his first appearance last week on Capitol Hill, with prepared remarks that are virtually identical.
snippet: The JPMorgan Chase chief executive, who will testify on Tuesday before the House Financial Services Committee, plans to stick to the script from his first appearance last week on Capitol Hill, with prepared remarks that are virtually identical.
lead_paragraph: Anyone hoping that Jamie Dimon‘s second round of prepared Congressional testimony will reveal the full story behind his bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss — or any fresh details for that matter — is in for a disappointing read.

headline.main: In House Testimony, Dimon Sticks to Script
